metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8778 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via the sizeargument to the __hcreate_r function, which triggers out-of-boundsheap-memory access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8778` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.8').
